703619f-a.title: Brooklyn: Classon Avenue - Lefferts Place
703619f-a.text:
Classon Ave., east side, between Lefferts Place and Atlantic Ave.
The small house in the foreground (known as the 2eller house), was built for
officers of the Brooklyn Betanical Garden in 1868; it was moved to its pre-
sent lecatien, and the extension at the rear added. In 1908 Charles 2eller
who lived in it, sold a part of his land to the trustees of the Hely Trinity
Baptist Church, which is seen in the view.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703619f-a.folder: Classon Avenue & Lefferts Place, Brooklyn, NY
